snippet: As the health care system braces for a wave of baby boomers, many are already helping others, serving as patient advocates and providing clinics with management help.
abstract: Older volunteers are getting involved in programs that train them to help their peers navigate the health care system and provide other services, like arranging transportation; encouraged by an emphasis on primary care, care coordination and chronic disease management, pilot programs are emerging to try to improve the fragmented medical system.
lead_paragraph: As the health care system braces for a wave of baby boomers, many are already helping others, serving as patient advocates and providing clinics with management help.

headline.seo: Baby Boomers Step Up as Health Care Volunteers
headline.main: Found: Older Volunteers to Fill Labor Shortage
headline.print_headline: Found: Older Volunteers to Fill Labor Shortage
